entry.title: anything for charity
entry.summary:
Author: 4LiberTEA

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 17,368Chapters: 3/3Kudos: 41

Summary: The Daily Planet is experiencing financial difficulties, and their solution? A date auction! The problem? Clark is one of the wares, and he is not happy about it. To make matters worse, Bruce Wayne is seen attending the event, a man that Clark Eat-the-Rich Kent has very pointed opinions about. Luckily, Clark won't have to engage with the man, so he can go on with his evening undisturbed... except the billionaire decides to bid for him. And he wins.

entry.title: Despite everything, it’s still you
entry.summary:
Author: VettTrece

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 77,085Chapters: 14/18Kudos: 449

Summary: Bruce Wayne, lonely, distrustful, and worn down by a city that never changes, witnesses the impossible: a man flies in front of him, no wires, no tricks, no logical explanation. Superman has arrived. Not as the man from Bruce's world, but as a figure who shouldn’t have crossed the threshold. He hails from a different universe, one with different rules. A place where, according to his logic, Bruce is meant to be his soulmate. But in this Gotham, there is no destiny, there is no hope. In his home there's no room for myths. Until now. Or: Clark isn't in his own world: the one where soulmates are as natural as the warmth of the sun or the darkness of night. He doesn't know how he ended up here; perhaps fate, perhaps chance, but undeniably the Gotham's vigilante spoke the first words destiny had reserved for him. And yet, everything feels strange, like a distorted reflection of the reality he once knew. Bruce, unaware of the burden Clark carries, chooses to help him find a way back to his world, and along the way, to uncover more about his own reality.Léelo en Español aquí.

entry.title: You can take the boy from the circus
entry.summary:
Author: Shelbyino

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 25,437Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 127

Summary: Damian Al-Ghul Wayne had everything at one point. He was a prince. Ibn al Xu'ffasch. Son of the bat. Heir to the demon.He had never asked to be ripped away from everything that he knew, from the warmth of his home, his culture, his palace in Nanda Parbat. He had never asked to be shipped to a gloomy, grey city.Even when his father kept taking in orphans and ruining his plans for inheritance, Damian stood steadfast.But then his father died, leaving behind his newest orphan.A tiny acrobat with watery blue eyes and black curls, who spoke no English. Damian knew the boy never asked to be ripped away from everything that he knew, from the warmth of his home, his culture, his circus troupe.Damian knew he needed to be there for him.

entry.title: [PODFIC] Enemies to Lovers
entry.summary:
Author: Demon_Sab

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 48Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 3

Summary: Written by susiecarter, read by demon_sab.Then: Bruce and Clark argued, fucked, kissed, and didn't talk about any of it until the day they stopped. Now: they're living together in the lake house, trying to figure out how to be around each other day in and day out without stepping on each other's toes or crossing any lines. Which might be easier if Clark weren't pregnant. Or if Bruce weren't being so weird about it. Or if the mother box hadn't rearranged Clark's insides on a whim in the first place—There's a lot that could have made this easier, basically. But then Bruce and Clark always did do things the hard way.

entry.title: like grey skies (like a bird of paradise)
entry.summary:
Author: rainbow_nerds

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,267Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 223

Summary: He sighed to himself and downed the glass of champagne he'd been nursing—non-alcoholic, but enough to convince anyone who might give him a passing glance. He hated this, every time he had to do it. There was one surefire way to derail anyone who began wondering whether maybe Bruce Wayne was doing more than just donating funds to Batman.His tie hung loose around his neck, shirt unbuttoned to halfway down his chest, laughing too easily, pressing close to everyone he spoke to, whispering in ears, playing the part, until he turned and froze on the spot.Clark Kent, in his signature ill-fitting suit, stood holding a notebook and pen, staring at him with barely-concealed glee.Bruce cringed internally. He hated this. He especially hated when it had to be witnessed by someone he actually respected.or: After a Gala, Bruce and Clark end up in bed together. They're friends, just helping each other out, no strings attached. Which would be great, if Bruce hadn't been halfway to head-over-heels since the day they met.

entry.title: The Company We Keep
entry.summary:
Author: WrenA

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,783Chapters: 10/11Kudos: 114

Summary: They say you can tell a person by the company they keep and all Barry could say about Superman was that he was far from the goodie-two-shoes everyone made him out to be initially. If you were to go by said company:- The colleagues at the Daily Planet and especially Lois and Jimmy- Clark's parents who always send sweets- Clark's close friend, Thomas, who sports a permanent stubble, disheveled hair and dark circles under the eyes- The mysterious 'B' who Superman sometimes calls to call in a favor when something requires a more tricky investigation- Nightwing, who is part of the league but acts incredibly familiar to Supes- An assortment of friends that he keeps mentioning- A (possible) crime lord whose file keeps getting deleted from the Watchtower databases- An array of vigilantes that absolutely refuse to join the league and have an unhealthy obsession for bats- THE BATMAN!? THE BATMAN IS REAL and does Superman know BATMAN!?- Lex Luthor, a homicidal billionaire- Bruce Wayne, not a homicidal billionaire, just annoying- Superman's kids?!? Or glimpses into the life of Superman over time, as seen through the eyes of one Barry Allen.

entry.title: And Now It Follows Me Everyday
entry.summary:
Author: theFamousLivingDead

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 39,165Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 76

Summary: Gotham has a reputation that precedes itself, but these days even her city limits are overrun with chaos. The streets are littered with rumors about a new shape above the skyline. The docks have been taken over by gangs and civilians are forced to keep to a curfew for their own safety. Bruce Wayne is stumped when all his attempts to prevent crime from taking off in Gotham are thwarted by a lightningfast shadow. His worst nightmare comes true -- there is someone else out there, more powerful than he could ever train himself to be, and he's not on his side of history. In which Clark Kent went out to find more about himself and his origins, but the League of Assassins found him first.
